content: Bank Account Asked by Kelly TrinhAsked 4w agoIs it possible to transfer USD within two domestic banks electronically?Anyone with payments background who knows the details of the financial plumbing in SG?Moving money between Citi / HSBC via paper cheques is really inefficient...1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Cedric Jamie Soh, Director at Seniorcare.com.sgTop Contributor (Sep)Level 7. Grand MasterAnswered 4w agoYes, you can, although the transfer is within 2 Singapore bank (I assume your "domestic banks" means in Singapore), it's actually done by international TT for USD. The charge is about USD $15.USD Cheque is cheaper (or even free). Get a USD cheque from DBS, for example, and you can bank into your USD account in SCB, OCBC etc.1 comment0

Kelly Trinh4w agoI was hoping to avoid the TT route, perhaps should have phrased the question as - is there a USD clearing/settlement system in place between Singapore banks that can be accessed through the internet banking... I believe there is something in place for USD in HK (but not exposure to general public through the internet banking seems to vary by bank).

For the cheque approach - that is what I use right now but it sure is a lot more of a a hassle :(
